name: LI Bo
personal background:
Before joining Comp@PolyU, I was a Postdoctoral Fellow in the Department of Computer Science at University of Oxford and in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at University of Texas at Austin. I received my PhD from the Department of Computer Science at Stony Brook University, and B.S. in Applied Maths and M.S. in Operations Research at Ocean University of China.

Algorithmic Game Theory and Mechanism Design
Computational Social Choice and Fair Division
Approximation and Online Algorithms <Bo Li is a researcher with multiple publications in various conferences and journals. He has also served as a PC member for several conferences and as a journal reviewer for prominent academic journals. Bo Li has taught courses at The Hong Kong Polytechnic University, including COMP 3011 Design and Analysis of Algorithms and COMP 6701 Advanced Topics in Computer Algorithms.> <The researcher completed undergraduate and graduate-level courses in Computational Game Theory at University of Oxford, and also took a course in Advanced Topics in System Modeling and Evaluation at The Hong Kong Polytechnic University.>
